results.title: Broken appointment
results.creator_credit: Willard Van Dyke, Irving Jacoby, Affiliated Film Producers and Mental Health Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the development of a young public health nurse to a mature realization of the importance of human contact between the professional and the patient and an understanding that emotional difficulties can interfere with physical welfare. The film describes the experience of a public health nurse who is attached to a baby health clinic. During the course of her work, the nurse helps a young mother to overcome the fears and worries associated with childbirth.

results.title: Broiling
results.brief_description: Demonstrates proper broiling procedures for meats, fish, and poultry, Shows how to mark meats, tests for doneness, turn without piercing, prevent sticking, coordinate with servers, and care for equipment.

results.title: The British monarchy
results.creator_credit: Derek Mayne, Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the function of limited constitutional monarchy in the present state of the British Commonwealth and Empire. The monarchy provides continuity and unity. The idea of continuity is presented by showing the historical development of the British monarchy, and something of the constitutional function of the sovereign. The idea of unity is shown by scenes illustrating the monarch’s public duties and their position in relation to other countries of the Commonwealth and Empire.

results.title: Briefing for health
results.brief_description: Indicates the dangers facing the female recruit when she joins the W.A.A.F. The ravages of venereal diseases are illustrated, with information on the avoidance of the disease and on measures to be taken if it is suspected that the disease has been contacted. No other credits available.

results.title: The Boy Kumasenu
results.creator_credit: John Hollingsworth, Sean Graham and Gold Coast Film Unit
results.brief_description: Dramatised documentary of a young African boy, Kumasenu, making his way unaided from the tribal world into the twentieth century. He has known no life other than that of a quiet fishing village. Wrongly accused of bringing bad luck to his people he becomes an outcast and an easy prey to the temptations of the city life of which his flash friend Agboh thinks so highly. Until helped by new friends, life for him is bewildering and dangerous.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Hollingsworth, Sean Graham and Gold Coast Film Unit

results.title: Boundary lines
results.creator_credit: Phillip Stapp, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: This film is a plea for human understanding of our fellows. Its message is that we must learn, as people, to live together in harmony and tolerance, making every effort to overcome the invisible lines which divide us against each other - lines which spring from fear, greed, hate, and prejudice, the boundary lines of environment, wealth, skin colour, religion, language and racial origin. The technique of this film is of particular interest; conventional animation is used sparingly; for its impact Boundary Lines relies mostly on drawings moved in relation to the camera.

results.title: Bouddi
results.brief_description: A camera calligraphy of the coastal bush at Bouddi, NSW. This film springs from a strong attachment to the Australian bush landscape, an echo of the spirit of kinship that imbued the life of the Aboriginal tribes. The film is a camera calligraphy moving through the bush, capturing textures, surfaces, shadows and light, details of foliage and expanses of rocks and trees, insects and birds - it sees the bush in much the same way as Aboriginal hunters may have seen it, moving rapidly through it. The complexity of the images is repeated in the Aboriginal music, visuals and sounds forming a rhythmic pattern.

results.title: Bottles into dolls
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Children's Library and Craft Movement
results.brief_description: Children learn to enjoy the art of making dolls from bottles, with plasticine. Imaginative use is made of a variety of materials at Brisbane’s Creative Leisure Centre. Costumes may be sewn, pinned or glued on to the figure and arms joined on with strips of plasticine. Finished figures are lined up and music-makers accompany the procession of completed dolls.

results.title: Borderline
results.creator_credit: Fergus McDonell, Grant McLean and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A story of conflict and rebellion in a teenage girl that, to a large degree, typifies the problems of emotional adjustment experienced by many adolescents in their striving towards maturity. We meet Nora Fenton, a disturbed 15-year-old girl who, because of her persistent defiance of parental authority and self-injurious behavior, is sent to a remedial home for problem adolescents. As the film reviews Nora’s problems, we see how understanding, affection and firm parental guidance are th factors most needed in helping teenagers weather their most turbulent years.

results.title: Border weave
results.creator_credit: John Curthoys and Turner Film Productions
results.brief_description: This is a study of Scotland’s woollen industry, and, in particular, the weaving of the famous rainbow-hued Border cloth. From all over the world comes wool for Border looms to manufacture into the finest woollen cloth in the world. This film shows the processes in detail, from the preliminary grading and scouring of the wool, the careful blending of the brilliant colors for dyeing and the spinning of the yarn.
